articles.description: Barnsley are expelled from the FA Cup for fielding an ineligible player in their first-round replay win at non-league Horsham.
articles.title: Barnsley kicked out of FA Cup for ineligible player

articles.description: Lionel Messi says there "could have been a tragedy" after Argentina's World Cup qualifier against Brazil in Rio is delayed because of crowd trouble.
articles.title: There could have been a tragedy - Messi

articles.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan says he is at a "crossroads" with snooker's governing body and could quit the sport if he has to reduce the time he spends in China.
articles.title: O'Sullivan future in doubt as he hits 'crossroads'

articles.description: As Wales prepare for the Euro 2024 play-offs in March, BBC Sport Wales assesses their potential semi-final and final opponents.
articles.title: Who could Wales face in Euro 2024 play-offs?

articles.description: Britain captain Leon Smith says he can "shout loud and proud" about his team as they look beat Serbia - led by Novak Djokovic - in the Davis Cup quarter-finals.
articles.title: GB aim to stop Djokovic and Serbia at Davis Cup

articles.description: Chantelle Cameron relives her historic victory over Katie Taylor before Saturday's rematch in Dublin.
articles.title: 'I actually did it, I beat Katie Taylor' - Cameron relives historic victory

articles.description: Celtic are fined £15,200 after fans flew Palestinian flags during the Champions League match against Atletico Madrid last month.
articles.title: Celtic fined over fans displaying Palestine flags

articles.description: Clubs signed up to the Football Association's Diversity Code collectively fail to meet any of their recruitment targets over the past year.
articles.title: Clubs collectively fail to meet diversity targets

articles.description: Novak Djokovic says the Davis Cup knockout phase "has to travel" as he prepares for Serbia's quarter-final against Britain in Spain.
articles.title: Davis Cup should not stay in Spain - Djokovic

articles.description: Argentina's World Cup-winning boss Lionel Scaloni says he is considering resigning after five years in the role.
articles.title: Argentina boss Scaloni says he may resign
